item.value: The shortest woman was Pauline Muster. She was 58 cm ( 23 in ) tall.
Yuma in the state of Arizona has over 4,000 hours of sunshine per year - making it the sunniest place on the planet. The South Pole is the least sunny place with only 182 days a year off sunshine
On average, Elephants sleep for about 2 hours per day.
The most widely spoken language is Mandarin, nearly 1 billion people speak it, mainly in northern and south-western China. English is the second most spoken language in the world.
The Cambodian alphabet is the world's largest alphabet, with 74 letters.
There are 9 planets that circle the sun. They are divided into two groups: the inner planets (Mercury, Venus,Earth, and Mars) and the outer planets (Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, and Pluto).
English is the second most spoken language in the world.

The Spine-tailed Swift is the fastest bird. It can fly at 170 kilometres per hour (105mph). The Peregrine Falcon is the fastest bird that dives headfirst down through the sky. They can travel at up to 200mph.
The biggest planet in the Solar System is Jupiter. It is 317 times as heavy as the earth
Electric eels can stun both predators and prey with electric shocks of around 500 volts.
The world's oldest person was Kama Chinen. She lived in Japan and died a week before her 115th birthday.
Opened in 2010, the Burj Khalifa in Dubai is the tallest building in the world. It is 828 meters ( 2,717 ft ) tall.
Alaska is the largest state in America.
The elephant is distinguished by its high level of intelligence, interesting behavior, methods of communication and complex social structure.
The longest recorded flight of a chicken is thirteen seconds
The explosion of Mount Tambora, on Sumbawa island, Indonesia in 1815 was heard 2,600 km (1,600 mi) away and has been called the loudest sound ever heard by humans.
The Population of the Earth is about 6,800,000,000 (6.80 billion) people.
The Amazon is the second longest river. It is 6.400 km ( 4,000 miles ) long. It flows into the Atlantic ocean.
The Cheetah is the fastest land animal. Cheetahs can run much faster than people.
The earliest dated printed book is the "Diamond Sutra", printed in China almost 3,000 thousand years ago.
